meta.title: Navbar
meta.description: The component <b-navbar> is a responsive wrapper that positions branding, navigation, and other elements into a concise header. It's easily extensible and thanks to the <b-collapse> component.

props.description: Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the component
Control the text color by setting to 'light' for use with light background color variants, or 'dark' for dark background color variants
Set to 'true' for an always collapsed navbar, or to a specific breakpoint at which point the navbar will be expanded: 'sm', 'md', 'lg' or 'xl'
Set to 'top' for fixed to the top of the viewport, or 'bottom' for fixed to the bottom of the viewport
Set to true to make the navbar stick to the top of the viewport (or parent container that has 'position: relative' set) when scrolled
Navbars are hidden by default when printing. When this prop is set it will be printed
Align the nav items in the nav: 'start' (or 'left'), 'center', 'end' (or 'right')
Proportionately fills all horizontal space with nav items. All horizontal space is occupied, but not every nav item has the same width
Fills all horizontal space with nav items, but unlike 'fill', every nav item will be the same width
ID (or array of IDs) of the collapse/sidebar components that should be toggled
String to place in the toggle's 'aria-label' attribute
When `true`, disables the navbar toggle button, and adds class `disabled` to the button

events.description: Emitted when the toggle is clicked.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Alternate content to replace the default Bootstrap hamburger

scope.description: `true` if the collapse is expanded, `false` otherwise.
